item.title: Quick?
item.dc:creator: @airborne airborne
item.description:
@airborne wrote:

LOL I FOUND MY PROBLEM! Look:
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“rareboss”)) {
if(playerHasItem(1547, 1)) {
teleportTox = 3220;
teleportToY = 3175;
sendMessage(“You teleport to the rareboss.”);
} else {
sendMessage(“You need the magenta key to teleport to the rare boss.”);
}
}
teleportToX = 3220;
teleportToY = 3175;
sendMessage(“You teleport to the rareboss.”);
} else {
sendMessage(“You need to magenta key to teleport to the rareboss.”);
}

item.title: Quick?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("rareboss")) { if(playerHasItem(1547, 1)) { teleportTox = 3220; teleportToY = 3175; sendMessage("You teleport to the rareboss."); } else { sendMessage("You need the magenta key to teleport to the rare boss."); } } teleportToX = 3220; teleportToY = 3175; sendMessage("You teleport to the rareboss."); } else { sendMessage("You need to magenta key to teleport to the rareboss."); }
You don’t need the second part.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick?
item.dc:creator: @airborne airborne
item.description:
@airborne wrote:

[code] if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“addnpc”) && (playerRights > 1)) {
try {
// statement.executeUpdate("INSERT INTO uber3_spawn SET id = " +
// npcId + “, x=” + absX + “, y=” + absY + “, live=1”);
server.npcHandler.newNPC(npcId, absX, absY, heightLevel, 0, 0,
0, 0, 0, 0);
sendMessage(“Npc added!”);
} catch (Exception e) {
e.printStackTrace();
}
}
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“rareboss”)) {
if(playerHasItem(1547, 1)) {
teleportTox = 3220;
teleportToY = 3175;
sendMessage(“You teleport to the rareboss.”);
} else {
sendMessage(“You need the magenta key to teleport to the rare boss.”);
}
}
teleportToX = 3220;
teleportToY = 3175;
sendMessage(“You teleport to the rareboss.”);
} else {
sendMessage(“You need to magenta key to teleport to the rareboss.”);
}
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“odump”) && (playerRights > 1)) {
BufferedWriter odump = null;
try {
odump = new BufferedWriter(
new FileWriter(“config//objects.cfg”));

			for (Object o : server.objects) {
				try {
					odump.write("object = ", 0, 9);
					odump.write(Integer.toString(o.id), 0, Integer
							.toString(o.id).length());
					odump.write("	", 0, 1);
					odump.write(Integer.toString(o.x), 0, Integer.toString(
							o.x).length());
					odump.write("	", 0, 1);
					odump.write(Integer.toString(o.y), 0, Integer.toString(
							o.y).length());
					odump.write("	", 0, 1);
					odump.write(Integer.toString(o.type), 0, Integer
							.toString(o.type).length());
					odump.newLine();
				} catch (Exception e) {
					e.printStackTrace();
				}
			}
			odump.write("[ENDOFOBJECTLIST]", 0, 17);
			odump.close();
			sendMessage("Dumped objects.");
		} catch (Exception e) {
			sendMessage("Dumped objects failed.");
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}[/code] Any other ideas JC or Chassy? Those are the commands above, and below my command.

item.title: Quick?
item.dc:creator: @IWBTG IWBTG
item.description:
@IWBTG wrote:

You close the command on the second line, basicly, you are implying that

if (playerHasItem(1547, 1)) {
		teleportToX = 3220;
		teleportToY = 3175;
		sendMessage("You teleport to the rareboss.");
		} else {
		sendMessage("You need the magenta key to teleport here.");
		}

is applied to every command in the custom command method.
Close the command after the if statements and your problems solved.

Read full topic

item.description:

That is my ::rareboss. Now everytime I use a command called ::pray2, that puts headicons on, it teles my to ::rareboss. Please help.
